quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Title
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, title, chords. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What female singer recorded the swing jazz song Candyman in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christina Aguilera

questions.question: This song from a 1962 movie that received the Academy Award for Best Original Song.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Days of Wine and Roses

questions.question: What rock band released the song Hot Dog in 1979?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Led Zeppelin

questions.question: From which album by the Spice Girls is the 1997 song Spice Up Your Life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spiceworld

questions.question: This composer, famous for the ballet Firebird, said, My music is best understood by children and animals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Igor Stravinsky

questions.question: Who made this statement: Without music, life would be a mistake.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Friedrich Nietzsche

questions.question: This man, who appeared in the animated film Fantasia, said, A painter paints pictures on canvas. But a musician paints pictures on silence.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leopold Stokowski

questions.question: What is the title of the song performed most famously by Billie Holiday in 1939?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Strange Fruit

questions.question: This prolific composer, who died way to young, said, I write as a sow piddles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mozart

questions.question: What is the title of the traditional calypso folk song performed by by Harry Belafonte in 1956?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Banana Boat Song

questions.question: What saxophonist said, A jazz musician is a juggler who uses harmonies instead of oranges.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benny Green

questions.question: This influential musician and producer, famous also as Rashidas dad, stated, Making a record is like painting a school bus with a toothbrush.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Quincy Jones

questions.question: This bandleader, who was once married to Charo, said, I would rather play Chiquita Banana and have my swimming pool than play Bach and starve.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Xavier Cugat

questions.question: What influential guitarist stated, If it has more than three chords, its jazz.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou Reed

questions.question: The 1998 song Chocolate Salty Balls is from the soundtrack of what popular animated TV series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Park

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Jesse Mccartney and Music
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, jesse. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Jesse McCartney guest-starred  as himself in an episode of the The Suite Life of Zack and Cody.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: About which recording group did Decca Records say this: We dont like their sound, and guitar music is on the way out.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Beatles

questions.question: In the early 2000s Jesse Mccartney was a member of what boy band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dream Street

questions.question: Name the person quoted here: It occurred to me by intuition, and music was the driving force behind that intuition. My discovery was the result of musical perception.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albert Einstein

questions.question: What member of the Beatles said this: Of course Im ambitious. Whats wrong with that? Otherwise you sleep all day.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ringo Starr

questions.question: Select the quote by Elvis Costello

options.text: I want to do a musical movie, like Evita but with good music.
My personal hobbies are reading, listening to music, and silence.
Writing about music is like dancing about architecture; its really a stupid thing to wan to do.
A symphony is a stage play with the parts written for instruments instead of for actors.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Writing about music is like dancing about architecture; its really a stupid thing to wan to do.

questions.question: Select the quote by Garth Brooks.

options.text: Love is friendship set to music.
My sole inspiration is a telephone call from a music producer.
The greatest conflicts are not between two people but between one person and himself.
Opera is when a guy gets stabbed in the back and instead of bleeding he sings.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The greatest conflicts are not between two people but between one person and himself.

questions.question: What artist said, People deserve the truth. They deserve honesty. The best music, you can seek some shelter in it momentarily, but its essentially there to provide you something to face the world with.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bruce Springsteen

questions.question: What musician said, There are more bad musicians than bad  music.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Isaac Stern

questions.question: Which of these is the first single from Jesse McCartneys debut album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beautiful Soul

questions.question: This Academy Award-winning artist said, Thats a hell of an ambition, to be mellow. Its like wanting to be senile.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Randy Newman

questions.question: Name the artist who said, I always felt that blues, rock n roll and country are just about a beat apart.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waylon Jennings

questions.question: What performer said, Its much too late  to  do anything about  rock  roll now.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerry Garcia

questions.question: Pop singer and actor Jesse McCartney was born on April 9, 1986.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In 2004 Jesse McCartney started dating a girl whose first name is what ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katie

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Jesse Mccartney and Member
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, jesse, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which member of Irish band Boyzone passed away unexpectedly on October 10, 2009 at the age of 33?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stephen Gately

questions.question: What is the name of the 1970 documentary movie about The Beatles that received an Academy Award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Let It Be

questions.question: In the autumn of 2005, Jesse McCartney toured Australia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: How did N Sync come up with their name?

options.text: They named the band after a music shop.
They named the group after a brand of electronics.
The name of the band is a play on the letters of the members first names.
A fortune teller told them they should be named so.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The name of the band is a play on the letters of the members first names.

questions.question: What kind of blood relationship did the members of the Bee Gees have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brothers

questions.question: Does Jesse McCartney have a brother?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: In what country was the boy band Five, or 5ive, formed in 1997?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: United Kingdom

questions.question: Which member of English boy band Take That titled his debut solo album Life thru a Lens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robbie Williams

questions.question: What is the title of New Kids on the Blocks debut album released in 1986?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Kids on the Block

questions.question: What was the name of the character, portrayed by Jesse McCartney on the soap opera All My Children?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adam J.R. Chandler

questions.question: Which member of the Backstreet Boys left the group in June 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kevin Richardson

questions.question: What term is used for the music created by The Jackson 5?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bubblegum soul

questions.question: Does Jesse McCartney star in the TV series Summerland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What was the original name of RB boy band Boyz II Men, formed in 1986 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Unique Attraction

questions.question: What is the title of Jesse McCartneys second studio album, released in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Right Where You Want Me

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Barbra Streisand and Movie

questions.question: For which of these American Presidents did Barbra Streisand campaign?

questions.question: For what song featured on the 1976 movie A Star Is Born did Barbra Streisand win an Academy Award as a composer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Evergreen

questions.question: Barbra Streisand shares her birthday, April 24, with this Academy Award-winning actress, and they are known for celebrating together.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shirley MacLaine

questions.question: This jazz great lived 1919-1956. He is remembered for his virtuosity and creativity yet many called his style unjazzlike.  He was legally blind in both eyes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Art Tatum

questions.question: When Bennie Goodman integrated jazz performances via his famous Carneigie Hall concert, this person was the pianist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teddy Wilson

questions.question: What type of causes does The Streisand Foundation, created by Barbra Streisand, support?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the occupation of Barbra Streisands character, Rosalind Focker, in the 2004 comedy movie Meet the Fockers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sex therapist

questions.question: Which great pianist was often called Fatha?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Earl Hines

questions.question: What is the first movie directed by Barbra Streisand, in 1983?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yentl

questions.question: The following lyrics are from which song by Carbon Leaf?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One Day

questions.question: What is the name of Barbra Streisands album on which she worked with the Bee Gees Barry Gibb?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guilty

questions.question: The band, Carbon Leaf, got their start at Randolph-Macon College in Virginia, in 1992.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What actor, director and producer did Barbra Streisand marry in 1998?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Brolin

questions.question: What was the first movie for which Barbra Streisand won an Academy Award?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Funny Girl

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Pianist and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, title, carolina. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Born in New Orleans around 1885, this pianist spent much of his younger years as a pimp, gambler, comedian, etc. In the late 1920s he became serious about music. He wrote many songs like London Blues and Black Bottom Stomp. He claimed to be the Originator of Jazz. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jelly Roll Morton

questions.question: Name the artist or group that performs this song.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aqua

questions.question: This New Jersey-born pianist began playing professionally at age 12.In the 1940s he played boogie-woogie style piano in New York City. He was the pianist in The Miles Davis Sextet.” Who is this composer of the hit All About Rosie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Evans

questions.question: Name this 1997 song.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Engel

questions.question: Name the band who recorded the song from the sound clip.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bomfunk MC`s

questions.question: Name the artist who performs the song from the sound clip.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2Pac

questions.question: Born in Montreal in 1925, this musician was introduced to music as a very young child by his father. In high school he played in bands with trumpeter Maynard Ferguson. At 14 he won a talent contest and that led to a job on a CBC program. From 1950-1955 he was voted the top pianist by Downbeat Magazine. Who is this great pianist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oscar Peterson

questions.question: Which pianist’s music does the musical Aint Misbehaving feature?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Waller

questions.question: He was born in North Carolina but was raised and gained fame in New York City. Who was this very influential pianist, the composer of the great tune Round Midnight?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thelonious Monk

questions.question: This New Jersey-born pianist was one of the inventors of the stride piano style. He wrote the song Charleston which began the great dance craze of the 1920s. Who was this great musician?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Price Johnson

questions.question: This Texas-born pianist was born in 1934. His career took off after moving to New York around 1956. He played with Coltrane, The Jazz Messengers, Benny Golson, etc. His most famous composition is Bolivia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cedar Walton

questions.question: What is the title of this 1996 song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dont Speak

questions.question: This keyboardist was raised in Philadelphia and was a neighbor of pianist Bud Powell. At 17 he played with John Coltrane. Eventually he was the pianist in the great jazz group The John Coltrane Quartet. Who is he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: McCoy Tyner

questions.question: She is one of the few women who have achieved great fame in jazz. This Atlanta-born pianist was already playing professionally by her teenage years. By 1941 she was staff arranger for the Ellington Orchestra. She was born Mary Elfrieda Winn Scruggs but was known as Mary Lou. By what last name did she play professionally?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Williams

questions.question: This Pittsburgh-born pianist was self-taught and could not really read music very well. His swinging style usually included long, beautiful runs. Despite his brilliance, most people only know him for his composition Misty.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Erroll Garner
